contents.name: README
contents.contents: Hi, I'm Rick Sullivan. I have a passion for computers, web applications, and math. I graduated from Santa Clara University in June 2015 with a major in Computer Science and Engineering and a Mathematics minor. Check out my Github account and resume or send me an email at rick@ricksullivan.net.

contents.name: alhambra.jpg
contents.caption: I spent a quarter studying in Spain. I had the time of my life and met some awesome people. Here's the view from the Generalife above the Alhambra in Granada.

contents.name: Operating Systems
contents.description: My Operating Systems classwork takes a look into the Minix kernel.

contents.name: Programming Languages
contents.description: My programming languages class approaches problems from various programming paradigms.

contents.name: Algorithms
contents.description: See my coursework for my algorithms class.

contents.name: Data Structures
contents.description: See my coursework for my data structures class.

contents.name: Embedded Systems
contents.description: See my coursework for my embedded systems class.

contents.name: Label Reader
contents.description: My undergraduate thesis project, which won best in group as decided by industry judges. We process images of USDA nutrition labels, using computer vision and domain knowledge to accurately extract data for use in applications. Completed in May 2015.

contents.name: Schedule Suggester
contents.description: Builds a custom year schedule for Computer Engineering or Web Design majors at Santa Clara. Accounts for AP and other credit students bring. See the code or the site.

contents.name: SCU Transcript
contents.description: A side project to format web transcripts downloaded from the eCampus website. Unofficial transcripts are plain text with formatting with tabs and spaces. When copied into Word, formatting is completely mangled; this app builds and compiles a LaTeX pdf document based on the given plain text.

contents.name: Project Euler
contents.description: See my solutions to some Project Euler questions.

contents.name: Too Many Friends
contents.description: Facebook friend remover. Suggests friends to remove by ranking friends based on how much you choose to interact with them. Was begun before realizing that FB removed from their API the ability to delete friends...always double check documentation, people.
